title: it's awesome, but ... TUN device would be nice
body: First of all: http://content.screencast.com/users/iksiq/folders/Jing/media/d81387e0-40ca-4bcc-b408-3c85b4749f06/2016-08-22_1336.png - that's just awesome ;-)

comments.body: It would be great if you could implement mknod so that we are able to create /dev/net/tun device. Then Cisco VPN could practically work.

I too would very much like to see Windows Shell support for the TUN/TAP Linux-style device, e.g. /dev/net/tun. In my case, I'm not interested in the VPN/OpenVPN stuff, but rather to be able to run OpenSource projects like Hercules in the Windows Bash Shell. Other applications too need the TUN/TAP interface.
As I understand it, other Linux networking features are also still missing from the Windows Bash Shell, e.g. the traceroute command still does not work (as of 1-Sep-2016; setsockopt IP_MTU_DISCOVER: Invalid argument).
Microsoft's commitment to add TUN/TAP and other missing networking elements to the Windows Bash Shell would be very much appreciated.
Peter Jansen
BTW. on this screenshot, we can see Xvfb + Fluxbox + x11vnc + xterm ;-)
